result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.

3:00 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Austin J Smage in court.  Attorney Thomas James in court for Austin J Smage.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes this matter was set over to address status of counsel and scheduling a preliminary hearing.  Atty. James advises that he will be formally retained in this matter and is requesting a preliminary hearing. Preliminary time limits waived. Court adjourns for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:04 AM Defendant Austin J Smage in court.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Defendant states that he is going to retain attorney James.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
The Court will adjourn.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:08 PM Defendant Austin J Smage in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court did receive a letter that attorney Tapia will no longer represent the defendant. 
 Defendant states he will be formally retaining attorney Thomas James as of this Friday.  Attorney James is currently in another court and requested the Court set a new status of counsel date. The Court adjourns for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
End of representation letter filed by Atty. Tapia.

10:53 AM Defendant Austin J Smage in court.  Attorney Thomas James, as a friend of the court, in court for Austin J Smage.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty. James requests an adjournment for time for the defendant to retain him. State does not object.  Preliminary time limits waived.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:55 PM Defendant Austin J Smage in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula. Jonathan Smage appearing in court, defendant's father.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Jonathan Smage makes a statement to the court. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
